snippet: The F.C.C. fund that subsidizes the installation of high-speed Internet connections at schools prioritizes bringing connections to a school or library over improving networks inside a school.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission officials say that chairman Tom Wheeler is planning to offer his fellow commissioners proposed regulatory change to promote Wi-Fi in schools; FCC is currently bound by rules governing a program that subsidizes installation of high-speed Internet connections at schools.
lead_paragraph: The F.C.C. fund that subsidizes the installation of high-speed Internet connections at schools prioritizes bringing connections to a school or library over improving networks inside a school.

headline.main: F.C.C. Chief Plans Action on Wi-Fi in Schools
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Chief Is Said to Plan Action on Wi-Fi in Schools
